OPSource Troubleshooting Guide

Common Issues and Solutions

1. Service Connection Issues

Database Connection Failures

Symptoms:

  • Service logs show database connection errors

  • API endpoints return 500 errors

  • Services fail to start

Solutions:

  1. Check Database Status

# Check if database is running
pg_isready -h localhost -p 5432

# Check connection string
echo $DATABASE_URL

# Verify credentials
psql -h localhost -U username -d database -c "\conninfo"

  1. Verify Network Connectivity

# Test network connection
telnet localhost 5432

# Check firewall rules
netstat -an | grep 5432

  1. Review Logs

# View database logs
tail -f /var/log/postgresql/postgresql.log

# View application logs
kubectl logs ${POD_NAME}

Redis Connection Issues

Symptoms:

  • Cache misses

  • Slow response times

  • Connection timeout errors

Solutions:

  1. Check Redis Status

# Test Redis connection
redis-cli ping

# Check Redis info
redis-cli info

# Monitor Redis
redis-cli monitor

  1. Clear Cache

# Clear specific key
redis-cli DEL key_name

# Clear all cache
redis-cli FLUSHALL

2. Performance Issues

High CPU Usage

Symptoms:

  • Slow response times

  • High system load

  • Service throttling

Solutions:

  1. Identify Resource Usage

# Check CPU usage
top -H

# Monitor process stats
pidstat 1

# View container metrics
docker stats

  1. Profile Application

# Run profiler
perf record -F 99 -p ${PID} -g -- sleep 30

# Analyze results
perf report

Memory Leaks

Symptoms:

  • Increasing memory usage

  • OOM errors

  • Service restarts

Solutions:

  1. Monitor Memory

# Check memory usage
free -m

# View detailed memory stats
vmstat 1

# Monitor specific process
ps -o pid,user,%mem,command ax | sort -b -k3 -r

  1. Analyze Heap

# Generate heap dump
jmap -dump:format=b,file=heap.bin ${PID}

# Analyze dump
jhat heap.bin

3. API Issues

Endpoint Failures

Symptoms:

  • HTTP 4xx/5xx errors

  • Timeout errors

  • Invalid responses

Solutions:

  1. Check API Status

# Test endpoint
curl -v http://localhost:8080/health

# Monitor API logs
tail -f /var/log/opsource/api.log

  1. Verify Request/Response

# Use API debugging tools
curl -X POST http://localhost:8080/api/endpoint \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"key": "value"}' \
  -v

Rate Limiting

Symptoms:

  • HTTP 429 errors

  • Throttled requests

  • Inconsistent response times

Solutions:

  1. Check Rate Limits

# View rate limit config
cat /etc/opsource/rate-limits.conf

# Monitor rate limit metrics
redis-cli --scan --pattern "ratelimit:*"

  1. Adjust Limits

# Update rate limits
kubectl apply -f k8s/rate-limits.yaml

# Verify changes
kubectl get configmap rate-limits -o yaml

4. Authentication Issues

Token Validation Failures

Symptoms:

  • Authentication errors

  • Invalid token messages

  • Session expiration

Solutions:

  1. Check Token

# Decode JWT
echo ${TOKEN} | base64 -d

# Verify token signature
jwt verify ${TOKEN} ${PUBLIC_KEY}

  1. Review Auth Config

# Check auth settings
cat /etc/opsource/auth.conf

# Test auth endpoint
curl -X POST http://localhost:8080/auth/token \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"username": "test", "password": "test"}'

5. Deployment Issues

Failed Deployments

Symptoms:

  • Deployment timeout

  • Pod creation failures

  • Service unavailability

Solutions:

  1. Check Deployment Status

# View deployment status
kubectl get deployments

# Check pod status
kubectl get pods

# View deployment events
kubectl describe deployment ${DEPLOYMENT_NAME}

  1. Review Logs

# View pod logs
kubectl logs ${POD_NAME}

# Check previous pod logs
kubectl logs ${POD_NAME} --previous

6. Data Synchronization Issues

Inconsistent Data

Symptoms:

  • Data mismatches

  • Sync failures

  • Stale data

Solutions:

  1. Check Sync Status

# View sync logs
tail -f /var/log/opsource/sync.log

# Check sync metrics
curl http://localhost:8080/metrics | grep sync

  1. Force Resync

# Trigger manual sync
./scripts/force-sync.sh

# Verify sync completion
./scripts/verify-sync.sh

Diagnostic Tools

1. Logging Tools

# Enable debug logging
sed -i 's/log_level=info/log_level=debug/' /etc/opsource/logging.conf

# Collect all logs
./scripts/collect-logs.sh

# Analyze log patterns
grep -r "ERROR" /var/log/opsource/

2. Monitoring Tools

# Check system metrics
prometheus-query 'rate(http_requests_total[5m])'

# View service health
curl http://localhost:8080/health

# Monitor resources
top -H

3. Debugging Tools

# Start debug session
dlv attach ${PID}

# Profile CPU usage
go tool pprof http://localhost:8080/debug/pprof/profile

# Trace requests
opentelemetry-cli trace

Recovery Procedures

1. Service Recovery

# Restart service
systemctl restart opsource

# Verify service status
systemctl status opsource

# Check logs after restart
journalctl -u opsource -f

2. Data Recovery

# Restore from backup
./scripts/restore-backup.sh ${BACKUP_FILE}

# Verify data integrity
./scripts/verify-data.sh

# Sync after recovery
./scripts/sync-data.sh

Prevention Measures

1. Monitoring Setup

# Set up alerts
./scripts/setup-alerts.sh

# Configure metrics
./scripts/configure-metrics.sh

# Test monitoring
./scripts/test-monitoring.sh

2. Backup Procedures

# Schedule backups
crontab -e
# Add: 0 0 * * * /scripts/backup.sh

# Verify backup success
./scripts/verify-backup.sh

# Test restoration
./scripts/test-restore.sh

Support Escalation

1. Support Levels

  1. Level 1: Basic troubleshooting

    • Log analysis

    • Configuration checks

    • Common fixes

  2. Level 2: Advanced troubleshooting

    • Performance analysis

    • Security issues

    • Complex bugs

  3. Level 3: Expert support

    • Architecture issues

    • Critical failures

    • Custom solutions

2. Contact Information

  • Emergency Support: support-emergency@opsource.com

  • Technical Support: support-tech@opsource.com

  • Security Team: security@opsource.com

3. Escalation Process

  1. Create support ticket

  2. Collect relevant logs and data

  3. Document reproduction steps

  4. Follow up with support team

  5. Track resolution progress
